lines.text: Oh, great... terrific!
[Advancing on Bugsy, who starts backing away]
He decides to keep the zoo open, so you kill him! Brilliant! Well done! Thank you so much, especially for shooting him right between the eyes,
[Points to his forehead]

so that it doesn't look like an accident. Because the people at Octopus will know that he was coming here to close us down, so there's our motive for murdering him. Stunning! Well, Mr. Brain of Britain, what are we going to tell the police, who are, of course, already on their way here? Another example of the thoroughness of your plan! Go on, I'm all ears.
[Bugsy stutters]
What do you suggest we do with the dead body of the incredibly famous man, who you have just... ASSASSINATED?
[Bugsy stutters some more]
Sorry, I didn't... quite catch it... What? What was that?... Pop him in the blender?
[Reggie hisses at Rollo, trying to point his attention away from Bugsy]
I KNOW! I KNOW HE'S DEAD! I DID NOTICE!
[Looks behind him, then back to Bugsy and Reggie, then straight back behind him]
Where's the body?
Told you I'd kick ass, Dad. What I really wanted to ask was, I, uh - I was wondering, could I get a raise?
Out of the question.
Why?
I don't have the money.
You got six billion dollars!
Seven, but things are tight right now. Who the hell's making all this bloody noise? Who's there?
[he opens the door and he sees no one]
Okay, look. Uh, what about a-a small advance on my inheritance?
What inheritance?
Well...
[nervous laugh]
I-I'm your son! You have to leave me something.
Why?
'Cause you... you screwed up my whole childhood!
How could I have? I wasn't even there.
You mean he's dead?

[sombre]
Yes.
And he's not coming back?

[sombre]
No. I'm sorry.
[Vince leans his head against the wall, as though grieving, then tilts back his head and everyone sees him laughing]
I'm so happy!
[to Rod's corpse]
You're dead! You're dead! You're dead!
[punching it]
You big-fat-bastard! YES!
You really don't like animals, do you?

No, it's not that I don't like them, I just don't see the point. I remember, when I was five, my mother got me this... dog. Pft. I just didn't *get* it. I suppose I had nothing I needed fetched. So I sold him.
How sad.
Oh, he got over it.
[Rollo is pushing a wheeled cage containing a lemur he's supposed to have shot]
What are you doing with that?
Uh... oh, the lemur?
Yeah.
Oh, just putting it back in its enclosure.
Why'd you take it out?
Ahhhhh... for a walk... you know, exercise.
It can hardly move in there.
Ah, no, no, the exercise is for me.
So what do you need that for?
That's a good point, actually. Um, well, perhaps I won't bother in future. Thanks for the hint.
[Turns to leave]
Hey, hey, hey, hey. Were you going to use that for target practice?
Oh, no. Ha.
Or, uh, one of your orgies?
[long pause]
Orgies?
Yeah. I'm onto you. You were going to put that somewhere. You're sick.
It's an anteater, not a maneater.
What would you be saying if it went over there, jumped into that pram? What would you be saying to the child's mother now?
a leaping anteater. An evolutionary mutant previously unknown to science."
Mate, Beijing called. We've got the television rights to their public executions.
Worldwide?
Five guys a week, guaranteed.
Beauty.
No, no. This is the kind of conversation that two people have when one of them is female.
I don't like you. You're weird and unattractive.
Mr. Sylvester Stallone didn't get where he is today by playing in Jane Austen.
For one thing, he loves animals.
Oh, he doesn't just love 'em.
Is there a history of insanity in your family?
I love this zoo.
I love zoo too.
What are you doing?
I'm freezing him.
Why?
He's gotta be cryogenically frozen until they find a cure.
Yeah, a cure? Vince, he has a bullet in the brain.
Well, get more ice.
Vince, there is no cure for a bullet in the brain. It is very fatal.
Now over here, this used to be the lion house, but as it's no longer suitable for animals, we're using it for middle management.
[He sees Pip and Cub kissing Rollo in a fit of gratitude]

What the hell do you think you're doing? Can you keep a lid on it till the sun goes down, for God's sake? You're supposed to be working, not prancing around in your cell like a... flamingo with a boner.
[Cub and Pip burst into Rollo's office, with Sydney close behind]
You didn't kill them!
What?
[Both women throw their arms around him]
We checked, they're all alive!
[Before he can say another word, they're smothering his cheeks with kisses]

[grinning]
You rascal!
[to Bugsy]
He was only kidding!

[as if he's known it all along]
Just figured that out, have you?

[still getting kissed]
I say...

I think the whole Octopus philosophy is poison. The only aim of any and every McCain business is to downsize and halve the quality, to make enough money to acquire another business to downsize and halve the quality, to make enough money to acquire *another* business to downsize, etc., etc., without ever running a single one of them really well. And if anyone ever raises the question of quality, they're immediately attacked as an elitist, because at Octopus it's considered morally offensive to talk about anything but money. All so that Mr. Rod McCain can feel a little more powerful every day. That's why, instead of running this *wonderful* zoo - properly - we've got to spoil it in order to finance his next *mindless* acquisition.
Why do you work for us, Rollo?
Cowardice?
About some of these sponsorship ideas.
Mmm?
I, I wonder if you and your fiancé don't, don't feel that... some, some of them are...

[interrupting]
Fiancé? Vince? No, no. No, no, we're not together.
Ohh, good.
"Good"?
Good. - I mean, I know we're not making 20% yet, but, but some of the marketing devices are a bit... a bit... crude?
Yes.
Good. Because, you know, the, the keepers and, um, and I were...

[looking into the lemur cage, while removing her jacket to expose a skimpy dress]
Oh, look at that. *Aren't* they *gorgeous*? Oh, they just make you want to *fondle* them...
Oh yes. Yes, yes, uh, yes, I see what you mean. Yes.
Is this one your favorite?
Yes, yes, I like him breast of... uh, best, ahem, of all the... the small mammaries. Mammals. (Sorry.) Ahem. Yes, his, his name's, uh, Rollo, actually.
Really.
Hm. Yes, so I, I sort of feed him some little special tits-bits. Tits. Tid, tid, sorry, tidbits. (Keep making boobs.) Anyway, he just... loves his nuts.

[slowly]
Does he? Hmm. And is, uh, Rollo very sexually active?
Well, he, he doesn't have a, a partner at the moment. You, you know, if he, if he had one...
One?
Hm?
I mean, just one? He wouldn't get bored, or...? I mean... you had two... in your cage the other day.
Oh, yes, huh. I mean, um, some of those, some of those sponsorship gimmicks are a bit sexcessive... exsexi... sexiss...
Excessive.
That's it, sorry. Freudian slit. Slut. Slot.
[the staff are now all reluctantly wearing animal costumes]

And I want to thank you all, personally, for the incredible enthusiasm that you've shown vis-à-vis our latest new innovative initiative. You look fantastic. You're no longer a bunch of smelly old animal keepers. No, as of today, you are official Theme Zoo Visitation Enhancement Facilitators.
What about the quality of the experience?
No, Rod says quality has never worked for him.
Right! Everything he touches gets tackier.
Well, that's the price of success.
You know what you are? You're pronoid.
"Pronoid"?

Mm-hmm. It means that contrary to all the available evidence, you actually think that people like you. Your perception of life is that it's one long benefit dinner in *your* honor with everybody cheering *you* on and wanting *you* to win everything. You think you're the prince, Vince.
[Vince opens the door and leans halfway into Willa's office]
Willa, can I ask you a question?
Sure.
Those breasts real?
Yes.

[Closes door, but we hear him through it]
Yippee.
[Reopens door and comes in]
You know, Willa, uh, you better be careful dressed like that around here. People will think you're sleeping your way to the top.
Just as long as they don't think I'm sleeping my way to the middle.
[Vince forgets the time zones when phoning England]
Oh, were you asleep?
Uh, yes, I frequently am at 2 A.M., I'm afraid. Uh, filthy habit I picked up in the Far East.
Oh well, gee, look, if this communiqué is in any way, uh, sleep-interruptive, I'll, uh, re-telephone you later.
[about the zoo's new owner]
Starting with his father's radio stations in New Zealand, he has built up a global empire currently worth more than six billion dollars... and growing.
How much does he want in the end?
Yeah.
What?
How much bigger does he want to get?
Well, there aren't any limits. He wants growth.
Presumably he's aware of Dr. E.F. Schumacher's concept of limited resources, or as Jean-Paul Sartre puts it...

[interrupting]
Any *sensible* questions?
[She wants him to think they'll have sex - eventually]
I think it's too soon.
Why?
Because what we have is special.
No it isn't.
He reminds me of my father.
Was your father ugly?
You saw the papers... the, uh, Vampire Gunman Runs Amok story?
I never have to listen to you again, do I? With your
[Switches to rod's voice]
"You're no son of mine, you miserable little worm! You've been a disappointment to me since the day your mother farted you out of her womb!"

[Turning to face Willa]
Brilliant!

[Disguised as Rod]
I'm going to the shed. Mother always said, when you're naughty, you go to the shed. And I've been naughty. God, I'm depressed.

[after being told the man that licks her daughter's blood is Rollo Lee]
Christopher Lee's more like it!
Did you get a whiff of that guy's cologne? Eau de Monkey Fart!

Scared? Oh, don't worry about Terry; he wouldn't hurt a fly. Well, actually, he *would* hurt a fly, bein' a Mexican red-kneed tarantula - Brachypelma smithii - and therefore particularly partial to flies. The point is that Terry has a bite relatively harmless to human beings, and you reacted as though he were fierce - which he isn't.

[squirms away]
Yes, I always had a bit of a thing about spiders, actually.
So... if creatures are *thought* to be fierce, they are, ipso facto... *fierce!*
Please, this is a wild animal! You get too close, it'll give you a nasty nip!
A safety pin would give me a nasty nip, Lotterby. I'll tell you what fierce is, fierce is biting the whole hand off!
The whole hand?

[who keeps gorillas]
Is it all right if it wrenches the hand off?
Oh, yes.
Whew!
We weren't playing tricks, Bugsy. We're trying to confront him with the reality.
Presumably you realize...
Bugsy, shut up! He's not a cold-blooded murderer. We've given him the five sweetest, cuddliest, most lovable...
[From the woods, they hear a series of five gunshots]
[Rollo plans to keep only fierce animals in the zoo and get rid of the rest. Lotterby is trying to make Rollo think that meerkats are fierce so they don't get thrown out]
No one's ever been attacked by one of those, Lotterby, or if they have been, they never noticed.
You're going to jail, Vince!
Aw, no - not again!

[looking at the will]
It's short!
Yes - the simpler it is, the more watertight!

[Discussing the fact that the animals can't be shot]
We'll get a tame vet to say they've caught some disgusting disease!
Pity this isn't Texas
Why's that?
We could charge people to do it for us!

[after catching Willa and Rollo kissing]
I can understand the gorrila, but not... not Mr Disgusting!

[Vince and Willa are looking at Rod's portrait]
Round here, he's known as Rod Almighty!

[Rollo has been caught being kissed by Pip and Cub]
Now I know why they keep him in a cage!

[holding rifle and walking alongside stretcher as it is carried along]
Bandicoot?
[Pip, lying down on stretcher, pulls back sheet to expose and raise her bloody bandaged leg]
My... GOD!

[props herself up on her elbows to talk]
It's just a Flesh Wound, sir!
[lowers leg whilst still in stretcher]
A few stitches, I'll be back at work!
Are you sure?

[as she is carried away offscreen]
Oh, don't worry sir! It's part of the job with the BANDICOOTS!

[Describing Rollo]
He looks like he's borrowed his body for the weekend, and hasn't figured out how it works yet!
How does he get three girls... where does the third one go?
Christ!
What?
That's a biggest goddamn spider I ever saw.
That's what's probably making the bleeting noise.
I don't like spiders. Kill it.
Vince, tell me about the sponsorships.
What sponsorships?
The ones you told Rod about.
I made them up.
Vince, I...
[She turns around, seeing Vince with his shirt off]
What are you doing?

[He turns around]
Getting undressed
[his pants drop]
For sex. I thought you were in the bedroom.
I was getting this dinner.
Oh, okay. You want to eat first?
